resources.string: Select an action to be performed when you tap on a song card in the flow.
If checked, Music Flow will automatically add songs played through your favorite supported music player.
Select an action to be performed when you tap on the ""Get Artist Info" button.

To get started, simply listen to music in your normal music player and songs will begin to be added to the flow. You can also add songs to the flow by tapping the microphone icon at the top of screen, which will identify the music being played around you.\n\nSee the help documentation for information regarding configuring certain music players to work with Music Flow, and tips on successfully identifying music through the microphone.

The following music players are known to work with Music Flow:

Android Music Player
Cubed - enable scrobbling
doubleTwist
Google Play Music
Last.fm
Meridian Player
PlayerPro
Poweramp\Rdio
RealPlayer
Spotify
Winamp - enable scrobbling

If your music player isn't listed, you can still enjoy Music Flow by turning on last.fm scrobbling in most cases.

In order to identify music "over the air", the music must be from a commercial source (no live music, singing or humming). The music must be at a reasonable volume and there can not be excessive background noise. While the Gracenote database contains millions of songs, in some cases the song may not able to be identified because the song is not in the database.
